Dialogue: In the past, when you were no more than a babe, your father brought his young wife and you to this cottage. They were a lovely couple. But not lovely neighbors. Speaker: witch
Dialogue: AND/ RIPPING UP THE RAMPION/   IN RETURN, HOWEVER,/ I SAID, "FAIR IS  FAIR:/ YOU CAN LET ME HAVE THE BABY/  THAT YOUR WIFE WILL BEAR,  13

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Good day, Mr. Wolf.

Dialogue: Whither away so hurriedly?

Speaker: lrrh

Speaker: wolf
Dialogue: And what might be in your basket?

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: It's bread for Grandmother so she'll have something good to make her strong.

Speaker: wolf
Dialogue: And where might your Grandmother live?

Dialogue: Goodbye, little girl./ AND HELLO... The WOLF climbs to the top of a precipice where he is silhouetted by the red hot sun. He lets out a mighty howl.

Dialogue: You frightened me! The WITCH swings to the ground.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Get it! Get it! Get it!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: How am I supposed to get it?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: You go up to the little thing, and you take it.

Dialogue: I can't just take a cloak from a little girl. Why don't you take it!

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Hello, Mr. Baker.

Dialogue: Have you saved some of those sweets for Granny?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Is that right? I would love a red cape like that.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: May I take a look at it? He quickly unties it.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: No!

Dialogue: I need it badly.

Dialogue: I'm sorry. I just wanted to make sure that you really loved this cape. Now off you go to Granny's -- and be careful that no wolf comes your way.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: The loveliest. They dismount and walk their horses through the forest.

Dialogue: I am not certain of that! I must confess, I too have found a lovely maiden. She lives here in the woods.

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: Yes! In the top of a tall tower that has no door or stairs.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: Two leagues from here, due east, just beyond the mossy knoll near the rose thickets.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: And how do you manage a visit?

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: I stand beneath her tower and say, "Rapunzel, Rapunzel, let down your hair to me." And then she lowers the longest, most beautiful head of hair - yellow as corn - which I climb. The WIFE is thrilled by this news, and runs off.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Rapunzel, Rapunzel! What kind of name is that? You jest! I have never heard of such a thing.

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: I speak the truth! She is as true as your maiden. A maiden running from a prince? None would run from us.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Yet one has. The PRINCES lead their horses to a stream that cascades into a magnificent waterfall.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Rapunzel, Rapunzel? Let your hair down to me. The window at the top of the tower opens and RAPUNZEL sticks out her head looking downward. The WIFE hides to the side.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Who is she? Where did she go?  49

Dialogue: Don't play the fool, woman!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I was trying to hold her here for you...

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I can capture my own damsel, thank you.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes, of course. The STEWARD returns, covered in burrs and looking none too happy.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: No sign of her, my liege.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Well, what are you waiting for? See if you can find her. The STEWARD rides off. The PRINCE pauses. The ultimate seducer, he gives the WIFE the once over.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Moo... Moo...... He HEARS sounds off in the distance.

Dialogue: The STEPFAMILY'S carriage is passing through a large hollowed opening in the base of a huge tree. We can hear the STEPSISTERS bickering, their blonde hair bobbing animatedly.

Speaker: another angle
Dialogue: The BAKER stands in the middle of the pathway, flagging down the carriage. He pulls an ear of corn from his satchel. As the carriage slows, he hops on the sideboard.

Speaker: stepmother
Dialogue: Mongrel!  Carry on! She pushes the BAKER off the carriage and he somersaults backwards into the brush. The CARRIAGE speeds off. Dialogue: Milky-White! He hears something and hides behind a BUSH. Then, seeing it is his WIFE, he steps out.

Dialogue: Three.

Dialogue: Where did you find it?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Three!

Dialogue: We've one entire day left. Surely we can locate the slipper by then.

Dialogue: We? You mean you're going to let me stay with you?

Dialogue: Well...perhaps it will take the two of us to have this child.

Dialogue: Where did you get this?

Dialogue: Where are the five gold pieces?

Dialogue: No, no, no - it's not how it sounds!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: No!

Dialogue: Your prince will never lay eyes on you again. He will never lay eyes on anything again!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: What did you do to him?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: It doesn't matter because where you're going, no one will ever see you again. The WITCH lunges at RAPUNZEL with a pair of SHEARS and begins to hack off her hair. The girl lets out a mighty shriek.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hey there - nice cape! The figure twists around, pulling a knife.

Dialogue: Stay away from my cape or I'll slash you into a thousand bits!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Whoa! I don't want it.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: My Granny made it for me from a wolf that attacked us. And she gave me this beautiful knife for protection.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Well, look what I have! A golden egg. He shows her his GOLDEN EGG.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I stole a hen that lays golden eggs from the kingdom of the Giant.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: I don't believe you.

Dialogue: It's true. And you should see the Giant's toy harp. It plays the most beautiful tunes without your even having to touch it.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I could.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: You could not!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I could!

Dialogue: You could not, Mr. Liar!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I am not a liar! I'll get that harp. You'll see! He runs off.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: We've only one day left! I don't know where to start.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: You can start by buying a new cow with the money you took from the boy.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Right, where do I buy a cow?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: You go to the next village, you'll find a cow there.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I'm going to get the slipper.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: The yellow slipper?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: The GOLDEN slipper!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Yes. The golden slipper, that's what I meant. How are you going to get it?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I have met a maiden with golden slippers these two previous nights.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: You think you could get one?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes, I'm sure of it. I'll meet you back here.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Because we have to if we're going to be together... The BAKER and his WIFE start to go off in opposite directions when there is a TREMENDOUS CRASH with the force of an earthquake. The BAKER and his WIFE are knocked off their feet and tumble into a bank of FERNS. They scramble to their feet and look to one another.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: HE'S A VERY SMART PRINCE,/ HE'S A  PRINCE WHO PREPARES./ KNOWING THIS  TIME I'D RUN FROM HIM,/ HE SPREAD  PITCH ON THE STAIRS./ AND I'M CAUGHT  UNAWARES./ WELL, IT MEANS THAT HE  CARES--/ THIS IS MORE THAN JUST  MALICE./ BETTER STOP AND TAKE STOCK/  WHILE YOU'RE STANDING HERE STUCK/ ON  THE STEPS OF THE PALACE.  ALL RIGHT, WHAT DO YOU WANT?/ HAVE TO  MAKE A DECISION./ WHY NOT STAY AND BE  CAUGHT?/ SHOULD I GIVE THAT A  THOUGHT,/ WHAT WOULD BE HIS RESPONSE?/ She turns around to see the PRINCE, frozen in time and staring at her.  CINDERELLA   60

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: The ball is over. Send everyone home.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: And the Princess?

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: She won't get far with one shoe.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Don't come any closer to me!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Please, stop! Just hear me out!

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: You have attacked me once before.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I didn't attack you. I attacked your shoe. I need it. I have a magic bean in exchange for it. Breathless, CINDERELLA stops. Stands defensively. The WIFE pulls out the bean from her pocket and hands it to her.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Magic bean? Nonsense! CINDERELLA tosses it over her shoulder, but they don't see the SPARKS it sets off when it hits the ground and sinks into the earth. She starts to leave.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Wait, please. I haven't much time!

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: That makes no sense!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Does it make sense that you're running from a prince? The STEWARD approaches on HORSEBACK.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I must go!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: (starts to take off a

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Thank you! Thank you! CINDERELLA dashes off.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: It's mine.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Lying will cost you your life! The STEWARD snatches the shoe. The WIFE pushes the Steward and grabs the slipper back.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: You will pay for this!  62

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Please give me the slipper, kind Prince, and all will come to a happy end.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Do as she says, Steward. We only need one.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Oh... He hands the slipper back to the WIFE. The STEWARD gets onto his horse.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Thank you. Thank you!

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: This very night! The PRINCE, STEWARD and RETINUE ride off, leaving the WIFE alone. She looks up to the moon and hurries off. We follow the WIFE'S feet as she scurries past the beginnings of a BEANSTALK CURLING UPWARDS from the ground.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Let it be known that his Royal Highness the Crown Prince will be visiting every house in this village tonight.

Speaker: stepmother
Dialogue: It's a perfect fit, Your Highness! LUCINDA winks at the PRINCE flirtatiously, then promptly faints to the ground with a thud. The shoe falls from her foot. The PRINCE nods to the STEWARD who walks over and gingerly picks up the bloody slipper.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Have you no other daughters?

Speaker: stepmother
Dialogue: Only a little stunted kitchen wench, which her late father left behind but she cannot present herself. She is too dirty. Out of the shadows, CINDERELLA appears. The STEWARD hands the slipper to the Prince, who kneels down in front of CINDERELLA and easily slips it on her foot.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I would recognize these beautiful eyes anywhere. This is the true bride! The PRINCE sweeps CINDERELLA off her feet and leads her to his horse. The two of them ride off. FLORINDA and LUCINDA watch, not at all happy. Then they hear a CAWING  overhead. They look up, alarmed. BIRD'S POV. Far below, FLORINDA and LUCINDA cower together, dreading what is to come as the CAMERA rushes towards them.

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: Rapunzel? Rapunzel?

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: My darling! She jumps into the swamp, fearlessly ignoring the SNAKES, until she reaches terra firma and her man. R-PRINCE falls from his horse onto the ground.

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: Rapunzel? Is it you? RAPUNZEL reaches him and rips off his scarf. She kneels to cradle his face, weeping.

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: How could she do this to you? EXTREME CLOSE-UP: RAPUNZEL'S TEAR falls into the R-PRINCE'S blind eye. The PRINCE'S vision is restored.

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: I can see you! The two of them embrace. At the same time, we hear MOOING.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Come on! We don't have any time... Then the WIFE rushes in from another direction, carrying the

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I've found you!  You've got the cow!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: You've got the slipper!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: We've all four! They hug with delight but are quickly startled by the WITCH who appears in the hollow of a tree.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: I see a cow. I see a slipper.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: And the cape as red as blood.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: And the hair as yellow as corn.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: We've done it!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: We've got them all. But suddenly the WITCH is suspicious.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Wait a minute!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Of course she is. A desperate glance at the BAKER. He couldn't have screwed this up -- could he?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: This cow has been covered with flour!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: What? You didn't get a real white cow? The BAKER turns to the WITCH.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: We had a cow as white as milk. Honestly we did.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Then where is she?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: She's dead.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: And we thought you'd prefer a live cow.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Of course I'd prefer a live cow! So show me the dead cow and I'll bring her back to life!

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: Jack! There you are! I've been worried sick about you! There's a dead giant in our backyard!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: There is?

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: You know there is. You could have been crushed!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: But Mother, look. The most beautiful harp.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: We're running out of time!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: It's here...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What's happening?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: She's going to bring Milky-White back to life.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: She's a witch! She can do anything!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Wow!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Stand back! They quickly move away, and the WITCH invokes some unintelligible incantation, and with the wave of her cape, the DEAD COW comes back to life, shaking off the leaves. JACK races over to her.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Milky-White. You're back! I missed you so much! The BAKER looks up at the MOON...only a slither left, the rest covered by SHADOW.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: It's almost midnight!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Quiet! Feed the objects to the cow.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: You heard me! Feed them to the cow! The WIFE and BAKER walk towards the COW and begin feeding it a portion of the ingredients. Not an easy chew for the animal. The WITCH hands them a silver chalice.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'll do it. She'll only milk for me. JACK begins milking the cow, the others watching intently, but alas, nothing is coming out.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Wrong ingredients. Forget about a child!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Wait! We followed your instructions. One, the cow is as white as milk. Correct?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: And two, the cape was certainly as red as blood.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: And three, the slipper--

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: And four, I compared the hair with this ear of corn.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I pulled it from a maiden in a tower

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: You what?! What were you doing there?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Well, nothing. I happened to be

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: I touched that hair! I told you! I cannot have touched the ingredients!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The corn! The corn!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What? JACK grabs the ear of corn out of the BAKER'S hand.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You can use the silky hair of the corn--

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Yes! Pull it from the ear and feed it to the cow. Quickly! The BAKER grabs the ear of corn from JACK, pulls the hair from the corn and feeds it to the cow. JACK begins milking the cow again. We hear the distant CHIMES OF MIDNIGHT begin. Light pours from above bathing them in a growing haze of BLUE LIGHT as the SHADOW finally eclipses the MOON. The COW lets out a BLOODCURDLING MOAN.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: It's working!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: She's milking! The WITCH grabs the chalice.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: At last! The WITCH drinks the potion. She begins to shake. Blue smoke begins to pour from her and swirl about as if she is trapped inside a cloud. The WIFE lets out a shriek.. The BAKER looks at his WIFE, her belly begins to grow to nine- months-full of pregnancy.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: That was quick! The cloud that has surrounded the WITCH now engulfs the area until a brisk wind blows it away, revealing a beautiful woman standing in the BLUE LIGHT of the FULL MOON. The WITCH has been restored to her former self, and she likes what she sees. The final CHIME OF MIDNIGHT is joined by every other BELL IN THE KINGDOM -- a joyous cacophony as we:

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Thanks for the slipper. The carriage arrives at the entrance to the castle. As the PRINCE and CINDERELLA step from their carriage they are met by cheers. The STEPFAMILY awaits the married couple. The beaming STEPMOTHER with her DAUGHTERS who are now wearing dark glasses, holding canes and looking rather glum. RAPUNZEL stands with her PRINCE. The CROWD ROARS as CINDERELLA and her PRINCE wave. The STEWARD takes up a large speaking trumpet and the CROWD quiets.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Let us cheer the newlyweds as they embark on their happy bliss today, and

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: Jack? Jack...? ANGLE ON BAKER and his WIFE.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I think so.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: And the baby?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes, he's fine. There is another AFTERSHOCK. ANGLE ON RAPUNZEL. She is spooked by the commotion and runs off through the crowd and disappears.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: (speaking into the

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: There's no need for worry. It was an earthquake in a far-off quadrant of our kingdom. Nothing to fear at all. As many of you know, we had another little shaker just days ago. I will personally investigate the disturbance. Now everyone, back to your villages, and on with your lives!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: What's happened? Everything's so different. They discover LRRH sitting on her suitcase in what was once a lush area, now trampled and broken.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Hello, little one. Are you alright? What are you doing here? With a suitcase?

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: I'm moving in with Granny. Our whole village collapsed. I couldn't find my mother anywhere. And now I can't find my Granny's cottage.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: I went down the dell, and I didn't recognize anything. There was no path.  Where's the stream? Where's the bridge? Where's Granny?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Calm down.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: We can help you find Granny's without the path.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes. The WIFE is exhausted. She hands the BABY to the BAKER.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Why does he always cry when I hold him?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: You needn't hold him as if he was so fragile. The BABY wails. The BAKER hands the bundle back.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: He doesn't want me. He wants his mother!

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I can't take care of him all of the time.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: I'll take care of him -- when he's older... They hear COMMOTION in the distance.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Who might that be?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: It's the Steward and the royal family.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What brings you into the woods?

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: The castle has been destroyed.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: stepmother
Dialogue: The kingdom is under attack.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What is the Royal family going to do?

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: I have no idea! I don't make policy. I just carry it out.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I think it best we get back to the village. We'll take the girl with us. She holds out a hand for LRRH.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: A giant woman! Through the trees we see the furious face of a female GIANT. We never see her in her entirety -- but the volume of her voice matches her size.

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: Where is the lad who killed my husband?

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: There is no lad here!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: We haven't seen him. The WITCH, who has slipped in behind the group, comes forward startling everyone and moves directly to the GIANT.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: We'll get him for you right away. Don't move! LRRH races past the WITCH and brandishes her knife.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: It was you who destroyed our house - not an earthquake.

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: And who destroyed my house? I want him! A great bellow that makes the trees shake. The WITCH moves towards the STEPSISTERS.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Would you like a blind girl instead?

Speaker: stepmother
Dialogue: How dare you? She wants the boy! And then JACK'S MOTHER arrives. Innocently, she asks the worst question possible.

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: Jack! Has anyone seen my Jack? He ran off again and I've been... Everyone stares at her. JACK'S MOTHER does a slow take looking up and discovering the GIANT.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: She's looking for him too.

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: Give him to me! The GIANT suddenly reaches down. They all quickly duck out of the way. JACK'S MOTHER runs forward to confront the GIANT.

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: Jack is just a lad! We had no food to eat so he sold his beloved cow in exchange for magic beans.

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: The boy - I want the boy!

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: You leave my boy alone!

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: You're making me very angry! The GIANT stomps her foot in anger.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Don't make her angry, woman, or you'll get us all killed! But JACK'S MOTHER is in full flow, facing up to the GIANT.

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Don't upset the Giant!

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: You big bully! I'll hide my son and you'll never find him. You'll never, ever...

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: Get back woman! The STEWARD forcefully pulls JACK'S MOTHER behind him. She trips and falls.

Speaker: stepmother
Dialogue: Yes, that's true.

Speaker: florinda lucinda
Dialogue: Yes. The steeple tower. We saw him there!

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: If he is not, I will return tonight and find you! All of you! The GIANT takes off, the power of her footsteps forcing everyone to hold on to one another for safety. The BAKER'S WIFE sees JACK'S MOTHER, who is still lying on the ground. She goes to her.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Look! What have you done to her?

Speaker: steward
Dialogue: I didn't mean to hurt her. I was just thinking of the greater good. The BAKER steps forward, taking charge.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Listen everyone. If we're going to get through this we have to stick together.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Not always. The STEPFAMILY leaves.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: What are we going to do now?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: We have no choice. Find the boy and give her what she wants.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: But if we do, she'll kill Jack.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: And if we don't she'll kill half the kingdom! She rushes back into the woods.

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: Promise me you won't let them get Jack. Promise!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Okay, I promise.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Rapunzel! You're safe! Thank goodness.

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Surely you remember?

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: This is who I truly am, my dear. Now you don't have to be embarrassed by me. You must come with me. There's a Giant in the land. She moves towards RAPUNZEL -- but suddenly the R-PRINCE rides up on his white steed. He jumps off and rushes to RAPUNZEL.

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: My darling. Are you all right? Why did you run off?

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: I was afraid.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: She's not going with you!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: I will not come with you!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Then you leave me no choice. The WITCH pulls RAPUNZEL behind her and tries to cast a spell on R'S PRINCE. Nothing. She tries again. Still nothing. The PRINCE takes notice of the Witch.

Speaker: r's prince
Dialogue: You! The one who blinded me.

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: ...and then banished me to an island -- in the middle of a swamp!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: I was just trying to be a good mother!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Rapunzel, no! You will never be safe with him.

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: Take me away from here. R-PRINCE pulls RAPUNZEL up onto his horse.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: No! Rapunzel!

Speaker: rapunzel
Dialogue: Don't you understand? I never want to see you again. Ever! ANGLE ON THE WITCH watching RAPUNZEL ride into the woods.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: We're never going to find him.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: We should fan out. It'll increase our chances.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: No. You can't be on your own.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I'll be all right.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What if we get lost?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: We'll count our steps from right here.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: I'll go, too.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: No. You stay with the baby. The WIFE hands LRRH the baby and sits her down.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: You would leave our son with her?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes. He's asleep. He'll be safe with the girl.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: See?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: But what if the Giant comes back...

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: What if, what if! Five hundred paces. Go! The WIFE turns and starts walking.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Wait! Take this. It might be cold.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: One eighty-one...one eighty-two... one eighty-three... one eighty-four... (looks up; startled;

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: You must be here to slay the Giant.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: The Giant?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes. Surely you've heard there is a giant in our midst.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Of course. A giant.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes, it's a lady giant. Unusual, huh?

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I should think. And why are you alone in the woods?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: I came with my husband. We were ... well you see ... it's a long story.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: He would let you roam alone in the woods?

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: No, actually it was my choice.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: How brave.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Brave?

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Yes./ ANYTHING CAN HAPPEN IN THE

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Well, yes, I do.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: And I have a...baker.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Of course, you're right. How foolish./

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Four eighty two... four eighty three...

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: The tree has fallen. Mother's grave, destroyed.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I shouldn't complain. I'm sure others have suffered worse after the earthquake.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Earthquake? It's no earthquake -- there's a giant terrorizing the kingdom!

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Well, I'm sure the Prince will see to it that the Giant is rid from our land.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Hah, the Prince? No doubt he's off somewhere seducing some young maiden.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: You look just like the Princess -- but dirty. Oh no, you are the Princess! He drops to his knees and bows.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Please. Please... Get up! I'm not a princess here.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I didn't recognize you.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I had to disguise myself. I'm not permitted to leave the palace unescorted. CINDERELLA looks away towards the wreckage of her mother's grave.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: If you'd like you can come with me. You will be safe in our company. CINDERELLA thinks for a moment, then nods.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: This way.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I must leave you. She looks at him confused. He walks over to his horse and mounts it.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: What was that?/ WAS THAT ME?/ WAS THAT

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: She should be back by now.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: She wouldn't get lost.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I'm sure she'll return.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: No, I must go and look for her-- They hear a commotion. It's the WITCH, who has JACK by the scruff of the neck.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Look who I found!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You're hurting me! The WITCH continues pulling the boy along.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Let go of him!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: I'll let go of him when I give him to the Giant.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Make her stop!

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Leave him alone! LRRH goes to try and pull JACK away from the WITCH. A tussle ensues, and the BAKER notices that JACK has dropped something. He goes over and picks up his SCARF.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: (at the top of his

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir...

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: It's my wife's!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I came upon her. She was at the bottom of a cliff...

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What are you saying? JACK can't say the words.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: How awful...

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: No. No...! As the truth sinks in.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Wake up! When you're dead, you're dead.  Now it's time to get this boy to the Giant before we're all-- CINDERELLA and LRRH block her way.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Keep away from him.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: This is no time to be soft-hearted! He's going to the Giant and I'm taking him. The BAKER grabs hold of JACK.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Yes! He's the one to blame! It's because of you there's a giant in our midst and my wife is dead!

Speaker: cinderella baker
Dialogue: IF YOU HADN'T DARED HIM TO-- AND YOU HAD LEFT THE HARP  ALONE,/  WE WOULDN'T BE IN TROUBLE/ IN  THE FIRST PLACE!

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: LRRH   WELL, IF SHE HADN'T RAISED  WELL, IF YOU HADN'T THROWN  THEM IN THE FIRST PLACE--!  AWAY THE BEAN/ IN THE FIRST  PLACE--!/ IT WAS YOUR FAULT!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: YES, IF YOU HADN'T RAISED THEM IN THE  FIRST PLACE--! They turn to the WITCH who has her back to them.  LRRH/BAKER CINDERELLA  RIGHT! IT'S YOU WHO RAISED YOU RAISED THE BEANS IN THE  THE BEANS IN THE FIRST PLACE-- FIRST PLACE!  !

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Shhhhhhh!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: No?/ YOU'RE SO NICE./ YOU'RE NOT

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Maybe I shouldn't have stolen from the Giant...

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Maybe I shouldn't have strayed from the path...

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Maybe I shouldn't have attended the Ball...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Away from here.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: But you said we had to find our way out of this together.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: It doesn't matter whether we're together or apart.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We need your help.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: You don't understand. My wife was the one who helped. I depended on her for everything.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: You would leave your child?

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: But wait...

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: baker's father
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I did a foolish thing.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Why would you do that? Why did you take the Witch's beans?

Speaker: baker's father
Dialogue: They were there and I wanted them. I didn't think. I was being careless --

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: -- Selfish.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: You stole them and you were caught, and then you did what you do. You just ran away.

Speaker: baker's father
Dialogue: When your mother died, I was... I hated myself and I ran from my guilt and my shame...

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: ... and your son.

Speaker: baker's father
Dialogue: Yes, and my son. And I'm sorry for that.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: If you're looking for forgiveness, you're not going to get it.

Speaker: baker's father
Dialogue: I never expected...

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Then what do you want?

Speaker: baker's father
Dialogue: Aren't you making the same mistake? The BAKER says nothing.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: If there were just some way we could surprise the Giant.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: She's too tall to surprise. They look up as a newly determined BAKER returns.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I knew you wouldn't give up.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: He wouldn't leave his baby.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: It looked like he was going to.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Give me my son. The BAKER takes the BABY. The baby begins to cry.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: What are we going to do now?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: We need to rid this kingdom of the Giant -- together.

Speaker: jack cinderella
Dialogue: What? No!

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: The birds can help!

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: You can talk to birds?

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: The birds will do their part.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Okay, we don't have much time.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm excited.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Here's what we're going to do... The BAKER leads them away from the tar pit.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Your father's being very brave. We're going to be very brave too. The C-PRINCE is passing a nearby path on horseback. He stops when he sees CINDERELLA.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: The Giant went in that direction. He rides closer.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: My darling!

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I'm well aware of that. He comes and puts his arm around her, but she pulls away.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: My love. What is it?

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Maybe I'm not your only love.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: If you love me, why did you stray?

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I thought if you were mine, that I would never wish for more.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: If this is how you behave as a prince, what kind of king will you be?

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I was raised to be charming, not sincere.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I think you should go.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I'm not going to leave you.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Consider that I've been lost. A victim of the Giant.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: Is that what you really wish?

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: My father's house was a nightmare. Your house was a dream. Now I want something in-between. She takes off her wedding ring and gives it back to him. He stands there for a moment, then mounts his horse.

Speaker: c's prince
Dialogue: I shall always love the maiden who ran away.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: And I the faraway prince. The PRINCE rides off.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Careful, there. Not so fast.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You needn't worry -- this is easier than a beanstalk. ANGLE ON CINDERELLA. She's sitting on a tree stump, rocking the baby. LRRH returns.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: They're in the tree -- over there. We made slings out of my cape. LRRH sits next to CINDERELLA.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I'm glad you're here to help me. LRRH turns her head away.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: I think my mother and my Granny would be upset with me.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: They said always to make them proud and here I am about to kill somebody.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Not somebody. A giant who's done a lot of harm.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: But a giant's a person. Aren't we to show forgiveness?

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Wait until my mother hears I've slain the Giant.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Jack, there's something you have to know. Your mother...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: She didn't make it.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Was she killed by the Giant?

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: No. It wasn't like that. She was fighting with the Giant, trying to protect you, and she was pushed by the Steward -- and -- she fell.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The Steward will pay for this.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: No, Jack --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: After we slay the Giant, I will slay him.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: You'll do nothing of the kind.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What he done was wrong. He should be punished.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: It's not as easy as that.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Here she comes!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Go, Jack! Be careful.

Speaker: wide shot
Dialogue: The GIANT approaches LRRH and CINDERELLA.

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: Where is the boy?

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: We have him.

Speaker: giant
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Here I am! The GIANT begins to move aggressively towards JACK. JACK and the BAKER load their slings.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Ready?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Ready! ANGLE on the GIANT'S feet, trampling everything in her path. Suddenly, she steps into the expanse of the tar pit, which slowly stops her in her tracks. She fights to free herself as she begins to sink.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Good birds!

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: She doesn't look happy. -- the BAKER and JACK use their slings to fire stones at the

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Where are they?

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Jack? Mr. Baker?

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Jack?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Over here!

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Jack!

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Oh, be careful, are you alright?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: He's not with you?

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: Mr. Baker? All three feverishly look for him.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Jack, Jack!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Help me. Help me!

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Jack, I'm here. CINDERELLA helps JACK lift the tree branch as the BAKER, breathless, crawls out from beneath its grasp. He is scratched up, but relieved. CINDERELLA takes the BABY from

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: Let me take him.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Are you okay? Are you alright? We did it! We did it! Come here. They embrace the BAKER. There's a moment of realization of what just happened as they look up at the roots of the fallen tree.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What home? I have no one to take care of me.

Speaker: lrrh
Dialogue: And we have nowhere to go, so we'll move in with you.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: If you want to.

Speaker: cinderella
Dialogue: I'll gladly help you with your house. There are times when I actually enjoy cleaning.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Here -- give him to me. The BAKER walks away from the group, trying to settle his SON. He wraps his SCARF around the BABY.

Speaker: baker
Dialogue: Shhhh. As the Baker holds his son close, the baby begins to calm down for the first time in his father's arms and his WIFE disappears. The BAKER tells the story to his son -- THE SAME STORY AS WE
